comments.body: hmm add the & here as well?

From my original description above:

> I've only added it for -q since you wouldn't see the message anyway. Without -q we don't background the generation.

This is because gen_egg_info prints to the screen.  If you background that, you'll get weird text printing to the terminal out of sync with anything else that is happening.
you could always redirect output to variable and print/not print it at the end

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +63,67 @@            find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -exec rm -f {} \; > /dev/null 2>&1
	else
	    gen_egg_info
            find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -exec rm -f {} \;
	fi
